subject: Data
title: The Prosecutor's Fallacy
description: A quick win: understand The Prosecutor's Fallacy.

hook.text: DNA evidence matches the defendant with a 1-in-a-million probability. Guilty? Not necessarily.

buildup.text: The prosecutor's fallacy confuses 'the probability of the evidence given innocence' with 'the probability of innocence.

discovery.text: In a country of 60 million, a 1-in-a-million match means 60 people match. The defendant is just one of them.

twist.text: This fallacy has contributed to wrongful convictions. Statistics misunderstood in court can ruin innocent lives.

climax.text: Conditional probability is one of the hardest concepts for humans â€” and courts â€” to apply correctly.

punchline.text: A rare match isn't proof. It's just a starting point.

quiz.question: What does the prosecutor's fallacy confuse?
options: The probability of evidence given innocence vs. innocence given evidence
